name: pkgx
description: Standalone binary that can run anything

readme.summary: Excellent documentation with clear installation, compelling examples, and strong quick-start guidance, though it could benefit from more troubleshooting content and configuration details.
readme.top_issue: Limited troubleshooting section and missing configuration documentation for common scenarios (caching, proxy settings, version pinning strategies)

injection_risks.description: The execve function is called with user-controlled input (cmd, args, env), which can lead to command injection attacks.
The expand_moustaches function uses string interpolation, which may be vulnerable to template injection attacks if not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Command injection vulnerability in the execve function call.
Potential template injection vulnerability in the expand_moustaches function.
security.summary: The pkgx package has several security concerns, including command injection and potential template injection vulnerabilities, which require immediate attention to prevent potential attacks.

common_complaints: External dependency on deno.land blocking installations in restricted networks
Project appears abandoned or unmaintained (last commit was months ago)
Limited portability across different shell environments (fish shell support missing)
praise_themes: Project concept is valuable as potential nix replacement
sentiment.summary: The pkgx project shows signs of maintenance stagnation with unresolved technical issues around permissions and network dependencies, combined with user concerns about the project's active development status, indicating moderate community health concerns.

communication.summary: The maintainer provides useful and technical responses, though there is room for more clarity in some areas.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-11-24)
46 open issues with no recent activity or closure
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no active issue triage
No merged pull requests in past 6 months showing no active development
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests no recent releases
maintenance.summary: The pkgx package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity in the past 6 months despite a recent commit timestamp, accumulating 46 unresolved issues with no triage or development activity.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good introduction to the package and its features, but some sections are dense and require close reading.
concerns: No commits in the past six months, indicating a lack of recent development or updates.
A high number of open issues (30) suggests there may be unresolved problems that need attention.
Docs: Lack of clear troubleshooting documentation
Security: Command injection vulnerability in the execve function call.
Security: Potential template injection vulnerability in the expand_moustaches function.
Security: The execve function is called with user-controlled input (cmd, args, env), which can lead to command injection attacks.
highlights: Recent activity with merged PRs and contributors active within the last six months indicates some level of ongoing engagement.
Regular issue management with closed issues in the past six months shows that efforts are being made to address reported problems.
